children.alt: One small apple being compared to a large pile of apples

children.value: Comparing values is one of those essential developer skills that helps you write
, and plenty more. Here's the apples and oranges guide to using them in JavaScript.

<BasicImage alt="Javascript's comparison operators give us a way of comparing values" src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/v1592262865/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/fruit-comparison/FruitComparison_P1.png" />

<BasicImage alt="Equality comes in loose and strict varieties. You should always use strict equality." src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/v1592262864/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/fruit-comparison/FruitComparison_P2.png" />

<BasicImage alt="Inequality follows the same loose and strict rules as equality" src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/v1592262862/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/fruit-comparison/FruitComparison_P3.png" />

<BasicImage alt="Relational equality let's us check which value is greater" src="https://res.cloudinary.com/dg3gyk0gu/image/upload/v1592262863/maggieappleton.com/egghead-course-notes/fruit-comparison/FruitComparison_P4.png" />
Want more illustrated notes on web development?
